question: Accessible sites are represented by peaks. How could PCR duplicates affect this?

answers.feedback: Try again. PCR duplicates represent a bias introduced during the preparation of the library. Having the exact sam sequence multiple times will cause multiple signals to align to the same coordinates, creating a build up of signal i.e. a peak.

answers.answer: These sequences will be randomly distributed across the genome.
answers.feedback: Not quite. PCR duplicates represent multiple reads with the same sequence and therefore will align to the same genomic coordinates. This can create an artificial build up of reads, i.e. a peak.

answers.answer: They can can change the intensity of peaks or create false peaks.
answers.feedback: Yes. PCR duplicates represent multiple reads with the same sequence and therefore will align to the same genomic coordinates. This can create an artificial build up of reads, i.e. a peak.
